name: connectionSettingsUpdate
description: Update default values for a connection's resource settings

x-apideck-consumer-id.description: ID of the consumer which you want to get or push data from

x-apideck-app-id.description: The ID of your Unify application

service_id.description: Service ID of the resource to return

body.description: Fields that need to be updated on the resource

$ul: **data**
**auth_type**: Type of authorization used by the connector

**authorize_url**: The OAuth redirect URI. Redirect your users to this URI to let them authorize your app in the connector's UI. Before you can use this URI, you must add `redirect_uri` as a query parameter to the `authorize_url`. Be sure to URL encode the `redirect_uri` part. Your users will be redirected to this `redirect_uri` after they granted access to your app in the connector's UI.

**configuration**

**enabled**: Whether the connection is enabled or not. You can enable or disable a connection using the Update Connection API.
**form_fields**: The settings that are wanted to create a connection.
**has_guide**: Whether the connector has a guide available in the developer docs or not (https://docs.apideck.com/connectors/{service_id}/docs/consumer+connection).
**icon**: A visual icon of the connection, that will be shown in the Vault
**id**: The unique identifier of the connection.
**integration_state**: The current state of the Integration.
**logo**: The logo of the connection, that will be shown in the Vault
**metadata**: Attach your own consumer specific metadata
**name**: The name of the connection
**oauth_grant_type**: OAuth grant type used by the connector. More info: https://oauth.net/2/grant-types
**resource_schema_support**
**resource_settings_support**

**revoke_url**: The OAuth revoke URI. Redirect your users to this URI to revoke this connection. Before you can use this URI, you must add `redirect_uri` as a query parameter. Your users will be redirected to this `redirect_uri` after they granted access to your app in the connector's UI.
**schema_support**
**service_id**: The ID of the service this connection belongs to.
**settings**: Connection settings. Values will persist to `form_fields` with corresponding id
**settings_required_for_authorization**: List of settings that are required to be configured on integration before authorization can occur
**state**: [Connection state flow](#section/Connection-state)
**status**: Status of the connection.
